segments.text: Good morning, ISS. Day 87 of the mission. Starting morning systems check.
Environmental controls first. Cabin pressure 101.3 kilopascals, nominal. Temperature 22 degrees Celsius, comfortable.
CO2 levels at 0.3 percent. Scrubbers are working efficiently. Humidity 55 percent, within acceptable range.
Oxygen generation system - flow rate nominal. We're producing what we need, tank levels stable.
Power systems next. Solar arrays generating 120 kilowatts. Battery charge at 98 percent. No issues there.
Communications array - all antennas operational. We're tracking three satellites for continuous ground contact.
Guidance and navigation - our orbital parameters are stable. Altitude 420 kilometers, velocity 7.66 kilometers per second.
We'll need a reboost in about two weeks. Atmospheric drag is slowly lowering our orbit, as expected.
Water recovery system - processing efficiency at 93 percent. We're recycling almost everything. Amazing technology.
Fire detection and suppression systems - all green. Smoke detectors functional, extinguishers charged.
Everything looks nominal. The station is healthy. Now let me check on the crew schedule for today.
I've got a science experiment session at 0900, then EVA preparation briefing at 1400. Busy day.
But first, breakfast. Even in space, coffee is essential. Floating over to the galley now.

environment.background_sounds: ventilation hum, equipment beeping, occasional item floating by
